alert.note: Alert for Victoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 1:15AM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Victoria County through 215 AM CST... At 115 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Telferner, or near Victoria, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Victoria, Inez, Victoria Regional Airport, Brentwood Subdivision, Telferner and Wood Hi. This includes US Highway 59 between mile markers 624 and 634. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
